intro: Acourtia pilulosa, commonly known as the pillowy acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that resemble pills, giving it its common name. Acourtia pilulosa is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
